para: Axis2HSV is an that converts the representation of an orientation into an .

The direction of the orientation's axis of rotation is represented by a declination &thgr; and an azimuth &phgr;. Axis2HSV maps the cosine of &thgr; into the HSV value, so that an orientation with &thgr;=0 is bright and &thgr;=180 is black. It maps the azimuth &phgr; into the HSV hue, so that &phgr;=±180 is red and &phgr;=0 is cyan.
The orientation's angle of rotation about the axis, &psgr;, is mapped to the HSV saturation, so that &psgr;=0 is fully unsaturated (white, gray, or black), and &psgr;=1 is fully saturated.

Note that this isn't a great way to convert orientations to angles, because small changes in orientation can result in a large change in color, and black represents more than one orientation (all orientations with &psgr;=0 or &thgr;=180).
